before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"b1h5","text":"Ensure that all appropriate authorizations and permissions for sampling of human tissue are obtained in advance - see protocol for details.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

19927.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"428an","text":"Animals are transcardially perfused with 0.12M Millonigs buffer (MB), ph=7.3, followed by 2% paraformaldehyde and 1.25% glutaraldehyde diluted in MB for ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"72b20","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"e04tt","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"emhg8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"822BAC9028B611E9AD1DC1C96808756B","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"step_guid":"B1DC54E0268A11E9AD1DC1C96808756B"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"54mpc","text":" Continuing the dehydration place 100% propylene oxide in the tissues for  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":74,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"dcpk6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"D9A2885028B511E9AD1DC1C96808756B","id":0,"label":"","step_guid":"57A3F68028AC11E9AD1DC1C96808756B"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ac37i","text":" Fix tissues with 1% Osmium solution diluted in ddH2O for   (Place vials with tissue +Osmium solution in circular shaker) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":51,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":58,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"bd7pt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8fmsh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e0oj9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9tdj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b7d0j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"68E0E98028B611E9AD1DC1C96808756B","id":0,"label":"","preset":[],"step_guid":"812FAF7028AD11E9AD1DC1C96808756B"}},"1":{"type":"safety","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6913d","text":"*Osmium is VERY TOXIC. Work in the fume hood and use appropriate PPE.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a9k1k","text":"Prepare Osmium solution at least one day in advance.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"29etq","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e550o","text":"Infiltration step starts with tissues in 50% propylene oxide+ 50% Epon solution for 2 hours. After, place 100% Epon resin in vials overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2oiua","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9nnpj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b1mf7","text":"Epon Solution:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5qm66","text":"Use Eponate 12 Kit, with DMP-30 (Ted Pella #18010).","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2ngot","text":"To prepare 100mL Epon: Mix 47.6mL of RESIN; 32.0mL of DDSA; 23.0mL of NMA; and 1.6mL of DMP-30","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cdjcl","text":"Cut semi-thin cross section (0.5μm) and place them on  glass slides.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmnu7","text":"Label sections with 1% toluidine blue solution diluted in ddH2O for  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":68,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"f4reb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":30,"guid":"A479B7B028B611E9AD1DC1C96808756B","id":0,"label":"","preset":[],"step_guid":"9113D7F028B111E9AD1DC1C96808756B"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8gkg2","text":"Wash sections with ddH2O, dry and coverslip with DPX medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":22,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d9mdk","text":"Acquire and analyze images (10X magnification for oveview image and 100X magnification for detailed image) using a Nikon Eclipse E600 microscope and Nikon camera DS-Fi3","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"65htv","text":"After dissection, the tissues of interest are postfixed in the same fixative overnight at 4°C and then rinsed 3 times with PBS for  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":131,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8j3ai","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"775EEF2028B611E9AD1DC1C96808756B","id":0,"label":"each","preset":[],"step_guid":"2FB8910028B411E9AD1DC1C96808756B"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ps2a","text":"Dehydrate tissues with alcohol solutions in different concentrations, as follow: 30%, 50%, 70, 80, 95, and 100% (twice) solution diluted in ddH2O   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":143,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":146,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"7c78q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"tt9j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fckpj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"4BD43C7028B611E9AD1DC1C96808756B","id":0,"label":"each","step_guid":"3BEB834028B611E9AD1DC1C96808756B"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7bpa","text":"Use 200 Proof Alcohol to prepare the solutions.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"btoop","text":"Block tissue of interest in plastic molds. Place the tissue in a direction to obtain cross sections later.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ae6j","text":"This protocol describes the methods used to generate samples of human vagus tissue suitable for TEM imaging.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: vagus nerve, TEM, transmission electron microscopy, human
manuscript_citation: Leif A. Havton, Natalia P. Biscola, Esther Stern, Plamen V. Mihaylov, Chandrashekhar A. Kubal, John M. Wo, Anita Gupta, Elizabeth Baronowsky, Matthew P. Ward, Deborah M. Jaffey, and Terry L. Powley. Human Organ Donor-Derived Vagus Nerve Biopsies Allow for Well-Preserved Ultrastructure and High-Resolution Mapping of Myelinated and Unmyelinated Fibers. Nature Scientific Reports 2021 Dec 13;11(1):23831. doi: 10.1038/s41598-021-03248-1.

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"872u5","text":"Vagus nerve samples were obtained intra-operatively from organ donors. Separate consents for organ donation and research were obtained. Informed consent for study participation was obtained from a parent and/or legal guardian. No organ donors were prisoners. A diagnosis of brain death or circulatory death as appropriate had been previously established by independent medical professionals according to local institutional regulations. All procedures related to tissue procurement and research use for tissues were in compliance with and approved by regulatory oversight review committees at University of Indiana School of Medicine, Indiana Donor Network or the local Organ Procurement Organization, and Purdue University. The vagus nerve biopsies were obtained from a continuous series of qualified organ donors meeting the diagnostic and medical criteria for organ donation and with consent for research participation in place. Donors from whom multivisceral transplants (lungs and stomach) were pursued were excluded from the research studies to enable removal of as complete sets of samples as possible. The research team was not involved with the identification and selection of organ donors.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5j98","text":"Age, gender, BMI, race, cause of death, and delay time between death and sample recovery were recorded for all donors/samples. All data was deidentified.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1tk5c","text":"After the completion of transplant organ harvesting, samples of the vagus nerve were collected. Approximately 10–20 mm long segments of the vagus nerve were removed from the following locations:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ihn2","text":"Cervical – left / anterior","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8g16","text":"Cervical – right / posterior","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8es06","text":"High abdominal trunk above hepatic and celiac branches – ventral / anterior","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7i89","text":"High abdominal trunk above celiac branches – dorsal / posterior","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hosc","text":"Ventral /anterior gastric branch at the level of the cardia","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26k9s","text":"All vagus nerve segments were immediately placed in a fixative solution containing 2% paraformaldehyde and 2.5% glutaraldehyde for 5 days at 4 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dboqj","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"4c19o","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"54r1t","text":"The fixative solution was changed daily and the specimens were kept on an oscillating plate during the immersion fixation process (at 4 °C). The fix solution was always refrigerated and was always less than one week old. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"","data":{"id":953446,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Paraformaldehyde BAKER J.T. Baker","linfor":"","url":"https://www.fishersci.com/shop/products/paraformaldehyde-baker-j-t-baker-2/02003576","sku":"02-003-576","cas_number":"30525-89-4","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"B6F244407D5711ECB85871C61C2FDC61","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":31,"name":"Fisher Scientific","link":"https://www.fishersci.com/us/en/home.html","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"","data":{"id":953441,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Glutaraldehyde 50% EM Grade Aqueous","linfor":"","url":"https://emsdiasum.com/microscopy/products/chemicals/glutaraldehyde.aspx","sku":"16320","cas_number":"111-30-8","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"CE6DC5907D5711ECB85871C61C2FDC61","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":50,"name":"Electron Microscopy Sciences","link":"http://www.emsdiasum.com/microscopy/","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d8177","text":"After completion of the fixation process, the tissue specimens were rinsed (3 × 30 min at 4°C) in PBS, transferred to individual shipping vials under PBS, and shipped overnight on ice to the TEM laboratory for further processing and microscopy - see the protocol below:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1eb51","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1ea0c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3fce2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"","data":{"id":19927,"title":"Nerve tissue processing for transmission electron microscopy (TEM)","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eNerve tissue processing for transmission electron microscopy (TEM)\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"nerve-tissue-processing-for-transmission-electron-xpxfmpn","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Natalia Biscola","affiliation":"Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai","affiliation_url":null,"username":"natalia-biscola","link":"","image":{"source":"/img/avatars/003.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/003.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":13},"type_id":1,"guid":"8776F300B9DA11E99CA40242AC110005"}}}}
